issues.title: Indexing stops for almost all repositories
issues.body:
Hello,

I am noticing that almost for every git repository configured in jira, after a while the indexing stops. The repository is deactivated. I can press Activate to get it working again, but after a while it stops working again.
Probably there are some exceptions during the indexing, I will report what I find in the logs.

Do you want the exceptions grouped into this one issue, or a seperate issue for each type of exception?

Valentijn

issue_comments.body:
```
2014-03-02 20:52:05,462 QuartzScheduler_Worker-0 ERROR ServiceRunner    Git Revision Indexing Service [xiplink.jira.git.GitManagerImpl] Error retrieving changes
 from the repository.
org.eclipse.jgit.errors.MissingObjectException: Missing unknown 4d17c065eceac197654703b41a6d584c93e2ef8e
        at org.eclipse.jgit.storage.file.WindowCursor.open(WindowCursor.java:111)

        at com.xiplink.jira.git.GitManagerImpl.parseCommit(GitManagerImpl.java:151)
        at com.xiplink.jira.git.GitManagerImpl.markUninteresting(GitManagerImpl.java:161)
        at com.xiplink.jira.git.GitManagerImpl.getLogEntries(GitManagerImpl.java:222)

        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)

java.lang.NullPointerException
```

Although this shouldn't happen, maybe just skip the revision that cannot be found?

issues.title: CopyBundledDependenciesMojo not found building the master branch
issues.body:
Hi,
I tried to build the master branch with both maven standalone and the one bundled with atlassian plugin SDK but I got the following error:

[INFO] Internal error in the plugin manager executing goal 'com.atlassian.maven.plugins:maven-jira-plugin:3.9.3:copy-bundled-dependencies': Unable to load the mojo 'com.atlassian.maven.plugins:maven-jira-plugin:3.9.3:copy-bundled-dependencies' in the plugin 'com.atlassian.maven.plugins:maven-jira-plugin'. A required class is missing: com/atlassian/maven/plugins/amps/CopyBundledDependenciesMojo
com.atlassian.maven.plugins.amps.CopyBundledDependenciesMojo

Any idea to solve the problem?

Thanks,
Andrea

issue_comments.body:
Hi, I got the same problem, have you solved it?

Thanks,
Andrea

issues.title: Links not being rendered correctly
issues.body:
![git_commit_plugin_error](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4932267/912348/31cbc998-fdff-11e2-9ce9-b2018e3d73d0.png)
I am using Jira 6.0.5 with the 0.6.1 plug in and everything was working up until recently.  It appears that the gitweb links are not being rendered correctly in the Git Commits tab.   Please see attached for what we are seeing now.

issue_comments.body: We are using gitweb that we host locally.  I upgraded Jira 2 weeks ago, and I haven't touched gitweb for some time.  The links were being rendered properly last week.  This just started to happen today.  I'm going to try and restart Jira to see if that fixes it.  I also opened a ticket with Atlassian to see if it's something on their side.
Restarting Jira didn't help.
Atlassian said that this is something that I have to take up with you guys since it's not something they control / manage.

issues.title: Authorization problem via HTTPS
issues.body:
Hi,
I'm using RhodeCode as my git server accessible only via HTTPS . Commits in JIRA (5.2.11) are displayed correctly when repo is public (does not require authentication). However, when the repo is protected I always got not authorized exception. Storing credentials either in _netrc (on windows) or in .git/config works with other git clients (eg  TortoiseGit) but JGIT from jira-git-plugin throws exception when trying to access repo.

2013-07-22 10:14:22,429 http-bio-8080-exec-15 WARN testuser 614x2091x1 38ouru 192.168.169.13 /browse/DEMO-4 [xiplink.jira.git.GitManagerImpl] 
org.eclipse.jgit.errors.TransportException: https://MyRepoURL/test: not authorized
    at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.TransportHttp.connect(TransportHttp.java:373)
    at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.TransportHttp.openFetch(TransportHttp.java:203)
    at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.FetchProcess.executeImp(FetchProcess.java:125)
    at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.FetchProcess.execute(FetchProcess.java:111)
    at org.eclipse.jgit.transport.Transport.fetch(Transport.java:904)
    at com.xiplink.jira.git.GitManagerImpl.fetch(GitManagerImpl.java:455)
        ...

issue_comments.body:
According to the JGit bugtracker HTTPS authentication was implemented somewhere around the end of 2010 (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=296201) .  jGit V0.10.1 which is included in jira-git-plugin is also from the end of 2010. Maybe simple JGit upgrade is required? I have built jira-git-plugin against jgit 0.12.1 (i've just change version in pom) but now exception is thrown on the jira startup 

2013-07-22 13:03:08,246 http-bio-8080-exec-1 ERROR   -   [jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher] Exception thrown from action 'ViewGitRepositories', returning 404 
WebworkConfigurationNotFoundException{class=class webwork.config.XMLActionConfiguration, message='No such view mapping', name='ViewGitRepositories.actionInfo'}

The plugin is disabled and when I want to enable it i got:

2013-07-22 13:12:09,450 http-bio-8080-exec-12 ERROR testuser 792x256x1 1wstbq4 192.168.169.13 /rest/plugins/1.0/com.xiplink.jira.git.jira-git-plugin-key [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] There was an error loading the descriptor 'Git Repositories Link on Administrators Page' of plugin 'com.xiplink.jira.git.jira-git-plugin'. Disabling.
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to enable web fragment
    at com.atlassian.plugin.web.descriptors.AbstractWebFragmentModuleDescriptor.enabled(AbstractWebFragmentModuleDescriptor.java:133)
    ...

issues.title: JIRA 5.2.x compatibility?
issues.body: It seems that this plugin is not compatible with JIRA 5.2.x?

issues.title: How to add multiple GIT repositories to JIRA at once using jira-git-plugin?
issues.body:
We are using jira-git-plugin v0.6. We have around 300 GIT repositories in development which we want to integrate with JIRA . 

I would like to know instead of adding GIT repository to JIRA one by one, is there any way to add all GIT repositories to JIRA at once?

Please reply with your suggestions.

issues.title: Exception with first commit on an empty repo
issues.body:
It seems that we got an exception when the first commit add some Jira reference in message.
As this is the first commit, there is no parent commit, it seems to raise an exception when gitweb view is activated ...

trace:

2012-06-27 23:01:51,140 http-8080-11 ERROR admin 1381x3999x1 1mw7kdq 192.168.1.50,127.0.0.1 /browse/TEST [velocity] Method getChangePathLink threw exception for reference $commit in template templates/plugins/git/projecttabpanels/git-project-tab.vm at  [128,29]

issue_comments.body:
It seems to be a known bug of JGit
see https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/1624/

Is it possible to update JGit ?

commits.message:
Merge pull request #8 from davidmc24/fix-project-tab-messages

project tab: fix bad messages

Merge pull request #9 from davidmc24/jira-6.x-support

Jira 6.x support

Merge pull request #4 from valentijnscholten/master

Add RhodeCode weblinks

Merge pull request #5 from foreveremain/master

patch pom.xml to avoid platform specitic encodings used for plugin metadata
[JGIT-77] Add support for Jira 5 - fixed Lucene version, backported changes from svn plugin and made compilable without atlassian sdk

issue_comments.body: quite easily, it's just a matter of changing the version of the jgit dependency within pom.xml and install, but from the issue above it looks like the fix should be already in the version 0.10.1 currently used

there is no such feature and I'm not planning on adding anything beyond Jira 5 support

an option might be hacking a SQL script on the jira database, don't know about the performance impact of 300 git sync jobs though, never tried that many

also you might try and ask the company that is bringing the development of the plugin forward as a paid version at https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.xiplink.jira.git.jira_git_plugin
pull request anyone?

commits.message: ensure UTF8 encoding used for platform independent builds

pull_requests.title: Add support for GitBlit
pull_requests.body: Add GitBlit template, add a special "encoded path" placeholder that works with the peculiar way GitBlit handles paths in URLs

pull_requests.title: fix exeption when initial commit is linked to an issue
pull_requests.body: Fix an error that appears if the first commit in the repository is linked to a ticket (the first commit doesn't have a parent)

pull_requests.title: Jira 6.x build support
pull_requests.body:
Updated POM file so it builds with the latet version of atlassian SDK.
Fixed a type cast error that prevented the plugin to be re-build on the fly using the atlassian SDK

pull_requests.title: Use @HtmlSafe annotation for Jira 6.1 escaping problem solve, update jgit version
pull_requests.body:
Hello.

According to https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Enabling+XSS+Protection+in+Plugins Html method suffix should solve problem HTML escaping in velocity templates, but it does not work for v6.1 for some reasons. Fix it by add dependency to velocity-htmlsafe and use @HtmlSafe annotation.

Also refresh jgit version and minor changes for compatibility.

issue_comments.body:
The subversion plugin has the same problem. See:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/173511/when-will-the-jira-subversion-plugin-be-available-for-version-6
for a workaround

#disable_html_escaping()
needs to be inserted in both the issue and project panel templates. I've verified that this works.

Just not sure what this will do to <6.0 compatibility.

Thanks therealprof

If the fix is as easy as commenting out disable_html_escaping() or similar it shouldn't be any issues releasing a JIRA 6.x compatible version.
Still. A release with the patch applied for 6.x is the way to go instead of having everyone monkey pathcing their installations.

I'm having the same Jira 6.x formatting issue with git as well.  

therealprof,  can you either post your code or tell me where to insert #disable_html_escaping() in the template files so that I can fix installation?

I added the #disable_html_escaping() line to the top of each xml template, update the jar file BUT I didn't restart Jira.  Once I restarted Jira the formatting issues is now resolved.  Thanks guys for the fix.

Do you have gitlab or something? I compiled latest master and links are working, leading to the wrong place, but working. There is pull request which may fix target for links https://github.com/mteodori/jira-git-plugin/pull/2, but did not test yet.
Same problem here!

Had same problem - with Jira 6.x you shouldn't use this version https://github.com/downloads/mteodori/jira-git-plugin/jira-git-plugin-0.6.1-SNAPSHOT.jar
This is 2 years old version, build from code compatible only with Jira 5.x.

Tu run this plugin with Jira 6.x you **HAVE to** download code and **build** it yourself!
@carvo can you share what are your build errors?

Hi,

are there any news about this? We have the same problem. Did somebody maybe fork this project, and what about the pull request which offers a solution?

Thanks!
Wolfram

@ljader 
Do U have some tutorial to build it? I try to clone in my PC and run "mvn clean install" (with ~/.m2/settings.xml configured) without success.

Thx in advance,
Carvo.
